Determine the first post-FYE program by student ID

Source: R/cip_after_fye.R
cip_after_fye.Rd

Subset a vector of student IDs to retain students ever enrolled in FYE and return the CIP code of their first post-FYE program.

cip_after_fye(id = NULL, ..., data_students = NULL, data_terms = NULL)

Arguments

id

character vector of student IDs
...

not used for values. Forces optional arguments to be usable by name only.
data_students

data frame of student attributes at matriculation
data_terms

data frame of term attributes

Value

data.frame with the following properties:

  • Rows for which student ID were ever enrolled in an FYE program

  • Columns id and cip6

  • Grouping structures, if any, are not preserved

  • Data frame extensions tbl or data.table are preserved

Details

Computing some persistence metrics, e.g., graduation rate, is complicated for students required to enroll in first-year engineering (FYE) programs. In such cases, we must predict the students' "starting majors." cip_after_fye() takes the first step in this process by identifying the programs in which students enroll immediately following their final FYE term.

FYE

First year engineering program, typically a common first year curriculum that is a prerequisite for declaring an engineering major

starting major

The degree-granting engineering program---for example, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, etc.---that we predict the student would have declared had they not been required to enroll in FYE.

The function accesses data_students (midfieldstudents or its equivalent) to restrict the IDs to those enrolled in an FYE program at matriculation. It also accesses data_terms (midfieldterms or its equivalent) to determine the 6-digit CIP code of a student's first post-FYE program. For students with no program after FYE, the CIP is NA.

See also

Other data_carpentry: completion_feasible(), order_multiway(), term_addition()
